resources.string: To recognize waste and help you with proper segregation, the app requires access to the camera. This allows you to take a photo of the waste, and we will indicate the appropriate bin for disposal.
"It seems that camera permissions cannot be granted in the app. To use the waste recognition feature, RecycLens requires access to it. You can enable it manually in the app's settings."
This bin should contain paper waste such as newspapers, cardboard, notebooks, sheets, and paper bags.
This bin should contain all plastic or metal packaging, such as bottles, cans, yogurt cups, clean food packaging, and plastic wraps.
This bin should contain non-recyclable waste such as meat scraps, cooking oil, receipts, cigarette butts, broken glassware, and porcelain, as well as used paper towels and tissues.
This bin should contain small electronic devices such as batteries, chargers, phones, remote controls, headphones, and small household appliances.
This bin should contain glass waste like bottles, jars, perfume bottles, and glass containers (excluding broken glass, mirrors, ceramics, and tempered glass).
This bin should contain biodegradable waste such as vegetables, fruits, eggshells, coffee and tea grounds, flowers, potted plants, and food scraps (excluding meat, bones, and fats).
Our model estimates the accuracy of this suggestion at
We couldn\'t recognize this photo. Make sure the object is clearly visible and try again.
If the issue persists, try taking the photo in better lighting against a plain background or check your internet connection.
Take a photo of the waste to dispose of
Our team is actively working on this feature. It will allow users to contribute to improving the waste classification model.
We sincerely apologize if this suggestion was incorrect. We are working on enabling users to evaluate photos to improve our waste classification model\'s accuracy.
